data.title: 2010/11 Season Statistics
data.meta_description: Find out how Manchester City performed during the 2010/11 season, view results, top appearing players and more!
data.text: 2010/11 was Manchester City's 109th season of competitive football - its 82nd in the top division of English football, its 14th (total) and its 9th consecutive season in the English Premier League. The leading goalscorer this season was Carlos Tevez who scored 24 goals from just 44 appearances. The player who made the most appearances for the club this season was Joe Hart who played 55 times. The club had 19 different goalscorers and used 35 different players including 14 debutants. Debutants this season were Abdul Razak, Aleksandar Kolarov, Ben Mee, Chris Chantler, David Silva, Edin Dzeko, James Milner, Javan Vidal, Jerome Boateng, John Guidetti, Mario Balotelli, Reece Wabara, Ryan McGivern and Yaya Toure. 1 honour was won during this season. See the competition results below for details.
